It has been proven that the brine shrimp lethality test (BSLT) has a good correlation with cytotoxic activity in some human solid tumors
16 . Application of BSLT in cytotoxic assays has been described for several essential oils
17 . Although the BSLT is able to identify strong anticancer activity of tested compound, its main limitation is its sensitivity to distinguish between strong to moderate and weak anti-cancer potentials
18 . Therefore, the BSLT represents a screening tool for potential cytotoxins, but a more sensitive distinction of anticancer activity requires testing on human cancer cells.
